subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_02EA_01C9E8D6.F2D8CE30
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Well what I meant was that if we are keeping sound separate from the EM spe=
ctrum, then it is generated as a bi-product of some other thing's movements=
 or vibrations. Such movements create waves in the environment that we hear=
 as sound.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka 
  To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, June 09, 2009 6:27 AM
  Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] New ideas





        No, that's not what I mean. By nature EM w=
aves don't normally make sound. The HAARP issue in the NW is believe to be =
caused by some harmonic of the actual EM wave. This is what I mean by secon=
dary effect. EM waves can still effect the physical, which is the reason mi=
crowaves can cook you if the power is amped high enough or causes a birds t=
o twitch in its transmission beam. I have stepped into a microwave beam at =
moderate power in while in the military. It doesn't hurt (at least at the p=
ower it was at) but it sure made me feel very strange. Of course microwaves=
 have very short wavelengths compared to VLF, ULF or SLF.

        Frank R.=


        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghostrese=
arch.com> wrote:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombieghos=
tresearch.com>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
          To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:49 PM


      =
    Right...gotcha. Sound is a bi-product more or less.

            ----- =
Original Message ----- 
            From: Frank Ratka 
            To: EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:46 PM
     =
       Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                  EM waves at the=
 VLF and ULF level can give off sound but only as a secondary phenomenon. I=
t sounds like a low hum to some people! I believe the most famous of these =
phenomenon was caused by HAARP.

                  --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Apri=
l Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


             =
       From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
     =
               Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                    To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                    Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 3:43 =
PM


                    So everything can be defined as from one of these =
forces. Objects from these forces can omit sound waves.

                  =
  Does that sound like a correct statement? Just trying to get my mind arou=
nd it.

                      ----- Original Message ----- 
               =
       From: Rj 
                      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
      =
                Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:33 PM
                      S=
ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                            April, standa=
rd physics today defines four fundamental types of forces: electromagnetism=
, gravity,  and the strong and weak interaction of elementary particles.  S=
o while EM is one type of energy (well, lets call it a force), there are a =
few others too.


                            --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abe=
rcrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                  =
            From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
=
                              Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
            =
                  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                            =
  Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:21 PM


                              This =
seems to jive with what I have learned this far, but I am still not certain=
 I understand it completely.

                              I thought every=
thing was based in the electromagnetic spectrum.

                         =
     ----- Original Message ----- 
                                From: Fr=
ank Ratka 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
  =
                              Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
         =
                       Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                 =
               Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum takes place bet=
ween 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves that our ears r=
ead as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The waves are still on t=
he electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves are present on=
 the scale. What I mean by power can be directll translated to volume or am=
plitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves from any other wave i=
s the fact that we can hear them.

                                Frank R.=


                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. c=
om> wrote:


                                From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>=

                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
         =
                       To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                       =
         Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM


                            =
    No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum nor are they a f=
orm of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on pressure waves in the=
 air (or in other substances).  Our ears detect these pressure waves and tr=
anslate them into sounds we here.  Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet energy=
.  Our eyes do: that part which we call visible light.



                 =
               --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wr=
ote:


                                From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yah=
oo.com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
  =
                              To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                =
                Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM


                    =
            It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."

                =
                A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking that there =
are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound waves and =
electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is frequency and =
power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain block of t=
he electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just =
farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can pene=
trate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelen=
gth the more ways we can shield against them.

                            =
    Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry trans=
mitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our environment b=
y causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than th=
is is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usual=
ly it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give of=
f IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously em=
itting IR radiation.

                                Frank R.

           =
                     --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercromb=
iegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


                                From: April=
 Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                       =
         Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
                 =
               To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                               =
 Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


                                Here=
 is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May 3=
0th investigation.

                                It was me and another g=
irl teammate present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digi=
tal voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right next to ano=
ther digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. Tha=
t recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was w=
ith me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.

                =
                I have long felt the true EVP does not come from sound wave=
s in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. =
Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.

                  =
              This instance with the recorders may back that theory up. Tha=
t other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves in=
 the environment.

                                I am attaching the clip =
of this 3rd voice. The file that is named "01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=
 You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right af=
ter that. I think I know what it says.

                                Aga=
in, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until playb=
ack. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the l=
ast investigation.


                                ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
                                From: Frank Ratka 
                =
                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                             =
   Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
                                Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                                I have a run=
ning theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exact=
ly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. I=
f you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if=
 you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate fr=
equency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have =
an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then yo=
u will have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human =
hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic=
 equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this =
theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the rec=
order.

                                We are able to reproduce this affec=
t in not only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics an=
d audio as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audi=
o spotlight" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

                                Frank =
R.

                                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.za=
ck@gmail. com> wrote:


                                From: Zack Widup <w=
9sz.zack@gmail. com>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]=
 New ideas
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
   =
                             Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


        =
                        Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are of=
ten not recorded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the act=
ual point where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital=
. 

                                So much we don't know ...

            =
                    Zack

                                 
               =
                 On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@a=
bercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




                                I=
 monitor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I=
 captured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording as i=
t happened. I only heard them upon playback.

                             =
   ----- Original Message ----- 
                                From: Zack=
 Widup 
                                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
     =
                           Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
           =
                     Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                   =
             I am curious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote sit=
e has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

                                I =
took part in an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Satur=
day night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls of the buildi=
ng. The video for all was being monitored and recorded at a central locatio=
n. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites conected to the ce=
ntral location. I wonder what we might have heard if we did?

             =
                   Zack

                                 
                =
                On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <T=
hreadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:


                                Let's just=
 agree to end this discussion about her... 
                               =
 Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new idea=
s about either evp or ITC? 
                                Al

           =
                      

                                 

                =
                 

                                 

                     =

op>No. Sounds waves are not on the 
                                electro=
magnet spectrum nor are they a form of 
                                ele=
ctromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on 
                              =
  pressure waves in the air (or in other 
                                s=
ubstances).  Our ears detect these 
                                pr=
essure waves and translate them into sounds we 
                           =
     here.  Our ear do NOT hear electromagnet 
                       =
         energy.  Our eyes do: that part which we 
                   =
             call visible light.<BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On 
                   =
             <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <I><warrior18eii@ 
            =
                    yahoo.com></I></B> wrote:<BR>
                      =
          <BLOCKQUOTE 
                                style=3D"BORDER-LEFT=

ust: inherit"

              =
                  <DIV>It sounds like she's saying "one, two, 
            =
                    ....."</DIV>
                                <DIV>&nbsp=
;</DIV>
                                <DIV>A mistake that a lot of people=
 make is 
                                thinking that there are two diffe=
rent types of 
                                energy at work when it comes=
 to sound waves and 
                                electromagnetic waves.=
 The only thing that 
                                seperates them is fre=
quency and power. Radio 
                                waves are radio wa=
ves because they occupy a 
                                certain block of=
 the electromagnietic spectrum. 
                                Sound wave=
s exist on that same spectrum just 
                                farther=
 down with much longer waves. Soundwaves 
                                a=
nd subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything 
                          =
      because of their wavelengths. The shorter the 
                      =
          wavelength the more ways we can shield against 
                 =
               them.</DIV>
                                <DIV> </DIV=
>
                                <DIV>Think of microwaves. These are also =
a type 
                                of radio and telemetry transmitting=
 wave but the 
                                waves also have a physical e=
ffect on our 
                                environment by causing molecu=
les to speed up, 
                                which creates heat. A lit=
tle lower than this is 
                                IR or infrared it t=
oo can cause physical objects 
                                to heat up b=
ut usually it just causes molecules 
                                to rot=
ate in place. All physical things give off 
                               =
 IR light. Its a way the total system conserves 
                          =
      energy by spontaneously emitting IR 
                                =
radiation.</DIV>
                                <DIV> </DIV>
        =
                        <DIV>Frank R.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09,

DIV>I have a running theory that EVP is carried 
                          =
      on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly 
                      =
          where they want it to manifest. It works off the 
               =
                 heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultrasonic 
         =
                       waves that differ one another in frequency then 
   =
                             if you add or subtract them together you get a=
 
                                beat frequency or alternate frequency. Fo=
r 
                                example, if a ghost is sending a signal =
at 54KHz 
                                and you have an electric fan in a=
 room creating 
                                an untrasonic frequency at =
45KHz then you will 
                                have a intermediate di=
fference frequency at 
                                9KHz, well with=
in human hearing range (20Hz to 
                                20KHz). Th=
is was just an example, but all 
                                electronic=
 equipment generates ultrasonic 
                                signals ju=
st by turning them on. From this 
                                theory I =
always felt that EVP were generated 
                                within=
 a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
                                <DIV>&=
nbsp;</DIV>
                                <DIV>We are able to reproduce t=
his affect in not 
                                only radio with superhet=
erodyne systems but also 
                                with acoustics an=
d audio as in some passive 
                                sonars and a co=
mmercial produce called the 
                                "audio spotlig=
ht" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
                                <DIV>&nbsp=
;</DIV>
